para.para: Autogenerated identifier classes and identifier objects to Themed Icons registered with .
Identifier classes should be used in attributes, XAML, or generic parameters. Where an value is expected, use the identifier object in the Id field of the identifier class.

remarks.para: This code was compile-time generated to support Themed Icons in the JetBrains application.

It has two primary goals: load the icons of this assembly to be registered with so that they were WPF-accessible and theme-sensitive; and emit early-bound accessors for referencing icons in codebehind in a compile-time-validated manner.
For performance reasons, the icons are not individually exposed with application resources. There is a custom markup extension to bind an image source in markup.
To use an icon from XAML, set an property to the markup extension, which takes an icon identifier class (nested in class) as a parameter.
Example:
Sometimes you have to reference an icon from a type attriute when you're defining objects in code. Typical examples are Options pages and Tool Windows.

To avoid the use of string IDs which are not validated very well, we've emitted identifier classes to be used with typeof() expression, one per each icon. Use the attribute overload which takes a for an image, and choose your icon class from nested classes in the class.
Example:
In codebehind, we have two distinct tasks: (a) specify some icon in the APIs and (b) render icon images onscreen.

On the APIs stage you should only manipulate icon identifier objects (of type , statically defined in in Id fields). Icon identifier classes (nested in ) should be turned into icon identifier objects as early as possible. Rendering is about getting an to assign to WPF, or to use with GDI+ / Windows Forms.

You should turn an identifier object into a rendered image as late as possible. The identifier is static and lightweight and does not depend on the current theme, while the image is themed and has to be loaded or generated/rasterized. You need an instance to get the image out of an icon identifier object. Once you got the image, you should take care to change it with theme changes — either by using a live image property, or by listening to the theme change event. See and its extensions for the related facilities.
Example:
remarks.code: // Getting IconId identifier object to use with APIs IconId iconid = DaemonThemedIcons.Recursion.Id;
// Getting IconId out of an Icon Identifier Class type IconId iconid = CompiledIconClassAttribute.TryGetCompiledIconClassId(typeof(DaemonThemedIcons.Recursion), OnError.Throw);
// Getting image for screen rendering by IconId themediconmanager.Icons[icnoid]
// Getting image for screen rendering by Icon Identifier Class themediconmanager.GetIcon<DaemonThemedIcons.Recursion>()
remarks.para: This code was generated by a pre-compile build task from a set of input files which are XAML files adhering to a certain convention, as convenient for exporting them from the Illustrator workspace, plus separate PNG files with raster icons. In the projects, these files are designated with ThemedIconsXamlV3 and ThemedIconPng build actions and do not themselves get into the output assembly. All of such files are processed, vector images for different themes of the same icon are split and combined into the single list of icons in this assembly. This list is then written into the genearted XAML file (compiled into BAML within assembly), and serves as the source for this generated code.

para.para: Autogenerated identifier class for the Recursion Themed Icon.
Identifier classes should be used in attributes, XAML, or generic parameters. Where an value is expected, use the identifier object in the field of the identifier class.

remarks.para: For details on Themed Icons and their use, see Remarks on class.

example.code: IconId iconid = DaemonThemedIcons.Recursion.Id; // IconId identifier object

para.para: Autogenerated identifier object for the Recursion Themed Icon.
Identifier objects should be used where an value is expected. In attributes, XAML, or generic parameters use the containing identifier class.

remarks.para: For details on Themed Icons and their use, see Remarks on class.

example.code: IconId iconid = DaemonThemedIcons.Recursion.Id; // IconId identifier object

member.summary: Returns element under caret

It has two primary goals: load the icons of this assembly to be registered with so that they were WPF-accessible and theme-sensitive; and emit early-bound accessors for referencing icons in codebehind in a compile-time-validated manner.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.CaretDependentFeatures.CaretDependentFeaturesManager.CaretStateChangedAndDocumentsCommited
member.summary: Fired if focused text control, caret position, viewport range or document is changed. Lifetime that is passed to this event must be checked for termination in event handlers. Invariants for lifetime passed to this event (if it is not terminated): TextControlManager.FocusedTextControl isn't changing TextControlManager.FocusedTextControl.Caret.Position isn't changing TextControlManager.FocusedTextControl.Scrolling.ViewportRange isn't changing TextControlManager.FocusedTextControl.Document isn't changing and is commited

member.summary: Invalidate daemon state for all documents

member.summary: Suspend/resume error highlighting & quickfixes activity

member.summary: Raised when DaemonState of any document is changed

member.summary: Raised when DaemonState of any document is changed

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.Impl.DaemonImpl.OnPsiModulesChange(JetBrains.ReSharper.Psi.PsiModuleChange)
member.summary: remove invalidated daemons

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState
member.summary: Normal state flow is the following: INVALIDATED->IN_PROGRESS_LOCAL->UP_TO_DATE->IN_PROGRESS_GLOBAL->UP_TO_DATE

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.HIDDEN
member.summary: Daemon doesn't need error stripe for given document.

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.UNSUPPORTED
member.summary: Daemon needs error stripe, but doesn't support error state

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.DISABLED
member.summary: Daemon is switched off for given document

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.INVALIDATED
member.summary: Daemon state is not valid for this document (i.e. something changed since last analysis)

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.IN_PROGRESS_LOCAL
member.summary: Daemon analysis is currently running local stages

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.IN_PROGRESS_GLOBAL
member.summary: Daemon analysis is currently running global SWA stage

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonState.UP_TO_DATE
member.summary: Daemon state is up-to-date for given document

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonTooltipProviderAttribute
member.summary: Custom tooltip provider for the error. Tooltip provider should be solution-level component and implement interface

member.summary: A factory for the gutter mark menu layouters.

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess
member.summary: Represents analysis for one source file. Consists of several - one for each .

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.GetStageProcess``1
member.summary: Get one of stage processes with given exact matched type

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.GetStageProcesses``1
member.summary: Get all stage processes with given exact matched type

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.GetCompletedStageProcesses
member.summary: Get already completed (during this process) stage proccessed.

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.CreateFibers
member.summary: Create fibers for multi-process thread execution

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.VisibleRange
member.summary: Area of document that must be analyzed first (before invisible parts) to provide highlighting results to user faster. For it is current of code editor.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.InterruptFlag
member.summary: Signals that current daemon proccess (and relevant daemon stage process) must be interruped. Process (and stage process) must verify this flag periodically and throw if it is true.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.CustomData
member.summary: This property is used to pass custom specific data to daemon stages (such as exclude some analysis in test cases).

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonProcess.FullRehighlightingRequired
member.summary: Can be used by stage process to understand do we need to start/continue analysis. Have no default implementation. For visible documents based on and sometimes previous call.

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.ErrorStripeRequest
member.summary: Defines the requirements for each stage

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.ErrorStripeRequest.NONE
member.summary: The stage doesn't require error stripe at all

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.ErrorStripeRequest.STRIPE
member.summary: Stage requires error stripe, but can't produce warnings/errors

member.name: F:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.ErrorStripeRequest.STRIPE_AND_ERRORS
member.summary: The stage requires error stripe and can produce warnings/errors

member.name: T:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonStage
member.summary: Represents a "stage" in code analysis process. Each stage should have a key that allows stages to refer to each other.

member.summary: Creates a code analysis process corresponding to this stage for analysing a file.
member.returns: Code analysis process to be executed or null if this stage is not available for this file.

member.summary: Set highlightings for the specific text range

member.summary: Array of result highlightings to be added to the editor

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonStageResult.FullyRehighlighted
member.summary: Indicates that the whole file was rehighlighted. If file was incrementally rehighlighted, then the range should be returned in

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonStageResult.RehighlightedRange
member.summary: Range in the document for which the highlighting was recalculated. All old highlightings that are inside this range will be removed from the editor and replaced with the returned ones.

member.name: P:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonStageResult.Layer
member.summary: Highlighting key modifier, so one stage could produce highlgihtings for different layers. Usually shouldn't be used

member.summary: Represents a code analysis process corresponding to one stage when analysing one file

member.name: M:JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.IDaemonStageProcess.Execute(System.Action{JetBrains.ReSharper.Daemon.DaemonStageResult})
member.summary: Executes the process. The process should check for periodically (with intervals less than 100 ms) and throw if it is true. Failing to do so may cause the program to prevent user from typing while analysing the code. Stage results should be passed to . If DaemonStageResult is null, it means that no highlightings available
